result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A. Hendricks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Transcript - April 16th Sentencing after Revocation

09:46 AM Defendant Kyle A. Hendricks in court with attorney Jennifer Amelia Cunha.  Defendant in custody.  Kenneth John Hamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  STATE:  Ct.1-3yrs prison - 1yr Init conf/2yrs Ext Supv. consec to any other sentence. 
 CUNHA:  Jail sentence - time served.  COURT:  Ct.1-3yrs prison - 1yr Init Conf/2yrs Ext Supv.   Absolute sobriety at all times. Not to possess any alcohol.  Not to use, possess, or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. no sexual contact with anyone under 18 years of age.  No contact w/MG-dob 1/7/2002.  Any counseling as recomended by agent.  Make good faith effort to obtain GED.  No firearms.  Eligible for Challenge and Substance Abuse program. DNA sample.  238 days credit.
